Key Match Events: Substitute Randal Kolo Muani's shot forced an own goal five minutes from time to give France a 1-0 win over Belgium.
Aurélien Tchouaméni forced Koen Casteels into his first save of the day soon after the break.
Theo Hernández made a brilliant tackle to stop Yannick Carrasco from scoring.
Romelu Lukaku and Kevin De Bruyne brought good saves from Mike Maignan.
Post-Match Reflections: Kevin De Bruyne called a reporter's question about his side's golden generation 'stupid' after Belgium's defeat.
Kolo Muani said after the match, 'I got lucky [on the goal]. The coach had told me to bring my energy ... to bring danger with my speed.'
France coach Didier Deschamps said, 'It's beautiful. It was tight, but we enjoyed possession and we had more opportunities.'
Deschamps added, 'We did a lot of good things. We have to savour it, it's quite an achievement. We're in the quarterfinals, they're going home.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: France will now meet the winner of Monday's match between Portugal and Slovenia in the quarterfinals in Hamburg on Friday.
The match was held at Merkur Spiel-Arena in Düsseldorf, Germany with an attendance of 46,810.
